fields.summary: Account delete does not delete the account's VPC

status.description: This issue has been validated/reproduced, but has not been prioritized yet.
status.name: Confirmed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
*Assessment*

When using LDAP/AD integration, if a cloud admin removes the LDAP/AD integration after users created resources, then re-enables it, but the updated LIC file doesn't include any of the old accounts, resources associated with those accounts are left on the cloud.  In particular, the following was noted:

* Keypairs, Access Keys, and Secret Keys were deleted
* Instances and ELBs were not deleted.  They were assigned to an account that no longer exists

*Signs*

* Created instances for a user/account (instance and ELB); after new LDAP/AD sync instances are still running:
{code}
++ with old LIC file and  LDAP/AD integration ++

$ euca-describe-instances --region account11-user51@
RESERVATION	r-25804621	689186510260	default
INSTANCE	i-D4F4425D	emi-5C8C3909	euca-10-104-7-10.eucalyptus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com	euca-172-17-125-185.eucalyptus.internal	running		0		m1.medium	2014-02-14T17:00:20.426Z	LayinDaSmackDown	eki-488A394F	eri-FE78360D		monitoring-disabled	10.104.7.10	172.17.125.185			instance-store					paravirtualized

$ eulb-describe-lbs --region account11-user51@
LOAD_BALANCER	Account11User51LB	Account11User51LB-689186510260.lb.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com	2014-02-14T17:01:45.375Z

++ after new LIC file and LDAP/AD integration ++

$ euare-accountlist --region admin@
account2	137614824505
account1	961915002812
eucalyptus	441445882805

 euca-describe-instances verbose --region admin@
RESERVATION	r-25804621	689186510260	default
INSTANCE	i-D4F4425D	emi-5C8C3909	euca-10-104-7-10.eucalyptus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com	euca-172-17-125-185.eucalyptus.internal	running		0		m1.medium	2014-02-14T17:00:20.426Z	LayinDaSmackDown	eki-488A394F	eri-FE78360D		monitoring-disabled	10.104.7.10	172.17.125.185			instance-store					paravirtualized
TAG	instance	i-D4F4425D	euca:node	node1
RESERVATION	r-CCD142BD	441445882805	euca-internal-689186510260-Account11User51LB
INSTANCE	i-77B84022	emi-B41335F3	euca-10-104-7-11.eucalyptus.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com	euca-172-17-114-152.eucalyptus.internal	running		0		m1.small	2014-02-14T17:01:56.905Z	LayinDaSmackDown	eki-71583A4F	eri-DD0D37F3		monitoring-enabled	10.104.7.11	172.17.114.152			instance-store					paravirtualized		0722c177-5c93-4198-90a3-277095144110_LayinDaSmackDown_1				arn:aws:iam::441445882805:instance-profile/internal/loadbalancer/loadbalancer-vm
TAG	instance	i-77B84022	Name	loadbalancer-resources
TAG	instance	i-77B84022	aws:autoscaling:groupName	asg-euca-internal-elb-689186510260-Account11User51LB
TAG	instance	i-77B84022	euca:node	node1

$ euca-describe-instances --region account11-user51@
euca-describe-instances: error (403 Forbidden): Failed to find access key
{code}
* In documentation, it states the following regarding [clean-deletion|https://www.eucalyptus.com/docs/eucalyptus/3.4/index.html#admin-guide/sync.html]:
{code}
Parmeter denoting whether to remove identity entities from Eucalyptus when they are deleted from LDAP. Set to true if you want Eucalyptus to remove any identities once their counterparts in LDAP are deleted. Set to false if you want these identities kept without being purged.
{code}

*Steps*

* Set up Eucalyptus 3.4.1 Cloud
* Download and source credentials for admin user of eucalyptus account:
{code}
$ euca-get-credentials -a eucalyptus -u admin admin.zip
$ unzip admin.zip
$ source eucarc
{code}
* Enable LDAP/AD Integration with atliens-v2.lic:
{code}
$ euca-modify-property -f authentication.ldap_integration_configuration=atliens-v2.lic
{code}
* Create resources for any account that has a number greater than 3 (i.e. account4 and higher); i.e. launch instances, create security groups, create cloudwatch alarms, etc.
* Disable LDAP/AD integration
{code}
$ euca-modify-property -r authentication.ldap_integration_configuration
{code}
* Enable LDAP/AD Integration with atliens-v3.lic:
{code}
$ euca-modify-property -f authentication.ldap_integration_configuration=atliens-v3.lic
{code}
* After sync is successful, notice how the resources are still on the cloud for the account that is no longer there

*Pertinent Data*

Not sure if this is a security issue or not, but it seems we should have the option to do the following:

* Assign those resources to another account (eucalyptus account maybe?)
* Have a confirmation step when accepting the new LIC file that removes accounts/resources that no longer exist
fields.summary: "clean-deletion" option in LIC file Doesn't Remove All Resources Associated with Deleted Accounts

comments.body: sosreports and test LIC files are attached.  You can see the syncing happening successfully when LDAP/AD integration is enabled.  _NOTE:_ There is a segment where there are LDAP sync errors.  This is due to the fact that the test LDAP server was down due to the brown out in the DC.

This issue was previously scheduled to be worked on in more than one sprint:
* '3.3 Sprint 4' (on board 'Test 3.3 Board')
* '3.3 Sprint 4' (on board 'Copy of 3.3 Release Board')

Starting from JIRA Agile 6.3, an issue can only belong to a single future sprint. Read more about this change: http://docs.atlassian.com/agile/docs-0640/Sprint+Marker+Migration

This issue is now scheduled for future sprint '3.3 Sprint 4' (on board 'Copy of 3.3 Release Board').

If this is incorrect, please update the issue accordingly.

This comment was automatically generated by JIRA. If it is no longer relevant, please feel free to delete it.
